name: Slide Maker
description: PowerPoint automation integration using python-pptx for creating, modifying, and extracting content from presentations

create_presentation.description: Create a new PowerPoint presentation with optional template. If template files (*.pptx) are provided in the 'files' parameter, the first template found will be used. Otherwise, a blank presentation is created. If title/subtitle are provided, they will be added as text boxes on a blank slide (no title slide layouts are used). Only blank slides are supported - all slides are created without predefined layouts or placeholders. Returns a unique presentation_id for use with other actions and the complete presentation file for stateless operation.

contentType.description: The MIME type of the file

content.description: The file content encoded as base64

custom_filename.description: Custom filename for the returned presentation file (optional, will auto-add .pptx extension if missing)

presentation_id.description: Unique identifier for the created presentation

slide_count.description: Number of slides in the presentation

saved.description: Whether the presentation was successfully saved

file_path.description: Path where the presentation was saved

file.description: The saved presentation file for streaming

content.description: The file content encoded as base64

contentType.description: The content type of the file

error.description: Error message if file streaming failed

add_slide.description: Add a new blank slide to an existing presentation. Requires the current presentation file in the 'files' parameter. Only blank slides are supported - all slides are created without any predefined layout or placeholders. Use other actions like add_text, add_image, or add_bullet_list to add content to the slide. Returns the updated presentation file.

set_text_autosize.description: Set automatic text sizing behavior for a text box or shape. Requires the current presentation file in the 'files' parameter. Use TEXT_TO_FIT_SHAPE to prevent text overflow by automatically reducing font size to fit within the shape boundaries. Use SHAPE_TO_FIT_TEXT to expand the shape to accommodate all text. Returns the updated presentation file.

add_background_image_workaround.description: Add an image as slide background using full-slide picture workaround. Requires the current presentation file and image file in the 'files' parameter. Since python-pptx doesn't support true background images, this adds a full-size image that covers the entire slide. Add other content AFTER using this action so elements appear on top of the background image. Returns the updated presentation file.

add_bullet_list.description: Add a multi-level bullet list to a slide. Requires the current presentation file in the 'files' parameter. This action automatically adds bullet symbols (•, ◦, ▪, ▫, ‣) based on the level specified for each item. Do not include bullet symbols in your text - just provide the plain text content and specify the level (0-8) for proper indentation and bullet styling. Returns the updated presentation file.

delete_element.description: Remove a shape, text box, image, chart, or any other element from a slide by its index position. Requires the current presentation file in the 'files' parameter. Use this to delete unwanted elements like text boxes, pictures, charts, tables, or any other shapes that were previously added to the slide. Shape indices are 0-based and correspond to the order elements were added. Returns the updated presentation file.

get_slide_elements.description: Get detailed information about all elements (shapes, text boxes, images, charts, tables, etc.) on a slide, including their positions, sizes, types, and boundary/overlap analysis. Content is automatically included for elements with detected problems (boundary violations, overlaps). Use the include_content parameter only when you need to see content for elements that have no issues. Requires the current presentation file in the 'files' parameter. Elements are listed in the order they appear on the slide, with index numbers that correspond to the delete_element action.

include_content.description: Whether to include text content for elements with no detected issues. Content is automatically shown for problematic elements. Only use true when you need content for elements that have no boundary/overlap problems (default: false for minimal output)

files.description: List of files including the current presentation file

slide_index.description: Index of the slide that was inspected

total_elements.description: Total number of elements on the slide

layout_status.description: Overall layout status: 'no_issues' if all elements are properly positioned, 'issues_detected' if there are boundary or overlap problems

elements_outside_boundary.description: Number of elements that extend beyond the slide boundaries

total_overlapping_pairs.description: Total number of element pairs that overlap with each other

boundary_warning.description: Summary warning message if any elements are outside slide boundaries

overlap_warning.description: Summary warning message if any elements overlap with each other

overall_warning.description: Combined summary of all layout issues (boundary and overlaps)

detailed_warnings.description: Detailed warning messages for boundary issues

element_overlaps.description: Detailed information about all overlapping element pairs

overlap_area.description: Area of overlap in square inches

width.description: Width of overlap area in inches

height.description: Height of overlap area in inches

element1_coverage.description: Percentage of element1 covered by overlap

element2_coverage.description: Percentage of element2 covered by overlap

severity.description: Overlap severity based on coverage percentage (high: >50%, medium: >20%, low: ≤20%)

elements.description: List of all elements on the slide

index.description: 0-based index of the element (use this with delete_element action)

type.description: Type of element (text_box, image, chart, table, shape, text_element, etc.)

content.description: Text content if the element contains text, otherwise empty

boundary_status.description: Element boundary status: 'inside' = fully contained within slide boundaries, 'outside' = extends beyond slide boundaries
